column1: These vaccine trials are very promising but until they’re available to the public -- wear a mask social distance wash your hands and keep gatherings to a minimum!  https://t.co/udoa17BUNc
President-elect Joe Biden is already taking real action against COVID. It’s nice to know the adults will be in charge again real soon.

Today is #NationalFirstRespondersDay - I’m grateful for the sacrifices they make every day. For the heroes on the frontline fighting COVID-19 or risking their lives running into burning buildings I’m fighting every day to make sure these heroes get the hazard pay they deserve!

The White House just put out a list of “First Term Accomplishments.”   Among them is “Ending the COVID-19 Pandemic.”  In the real world 226000 Americans died. 50000 are in the hospital. We’ve had half a million new cases this week! We can’t let this president get a 2nd term.

One year ago today long before COVID-19 appeared @JoeBiden warned us that President Trump wasn’t prepared for a pandemic.   But Donald Trump didn’t listen.   A President’s bad judgment does have consequences. https://t.co/jZXxmOJehw
NEW: The President's COVID plan. https://t.co/pSc1D3Uzoi
The American people are hurting. I’m grateful that @speakerpelosi is leading the fight to pass another COVID-19 relief package. Mitch McConnell needs to get out of the way. https://t.co/asZGFLKdRh

200000 people dead. Millions out of work. But Republicans still won’t pass a COVID-19 relief package. Why?   They’ve got their hands full this week spreading Russian disinformation and jamming through another right wing Supreme Court justice.  America deserves better.
My remarks on the House floor this morning as we approach 200000 COVID-19 deaths. https://t.co/5jCYN1tcuZ
Headed to the Capitol. Will be speaking shortly on the House floor about the President's failure to stop COVID-19.

We’re facing two crises at once -- the COVID-19 pandemic and an addiction epidemic that is claiming thousands of lives each year. This #RecoveryMonth I’m wearing purple to show those who are struggling that recovery is possible. https://t.co/Atmwn4vX54

50 days to go. Last night the President hosted another open mic night where he may have exposed thousands of Nevada voters to COVID-19.  Right now @JoeBiden is talking about a serious plan to confront the damage that’s been done to our environment. https://t.co/NBRQ35FLBC

The President knew how deadly COVID was. He kept holding rallies. He kept downplaying the risks. He ignored the experts.  It’s an unprecedented betrayal. Blood is on his hands.  If he had a shred of decency he’d resign. If Republicans had any integrity they’d demand it.
Trump’s “America First” is really just “America Alone.” To not join the world in distributing a coronavirus vaccine is effectively flipping off the entire planet.  https://t.co/emY9WYXzXG
.@nbc10 please tell me you’re not going to run this Sinclair-produced garbage that claims Dr. Fauci created coronavirus. https://t.co/FDaGMmCO84
We couldn’t trust him to tell us the truth about coronavirus back in February. So why should we trust him to do something with this important information today?! https://t.co/arelt4ZGMG
The President had the time to commute Roger Stone’s sentence today.   He still doesn’t have a COVID-19 strategy or a response to Putin putting bounties on American soldiers.
That's it. That's the white flag. President Trump is surrendering to COVID-19 and telling the American people "You're on your own." https://t.co/ti5HrONy55

Why is Trump obsessed with eliminating DACA? Many of these Dreamers are on the front lines helping fight coronavirus while the president tweets about conspiracy theories from the White House. https://t.co/YaJVXVWnsM

NEW: The COVID-19 pandemic is disproportionately hurting folks without means and communities of color. My thoughts in @GlobeOpinion on why we need to end these disparities with a National Commission to Restore the American Dream. https://t.co/U6mE8r3VBV
Once again the House will step up where the President and Mitch McConnell have failed to lead when we pass $3 trillion in COVID-19 relief tomorrow.
Local news is a critical pillar of our democracy. That’s why I’m pleased that the next COVID-19 relief package will make local news outlets eligible for PPP loans.

Proud to join @RepDavidEPrice to introduce a bill to create 750000 new @AmeriCorps positions to address & recover from COVID. Let’s use the best American talent to get us out of one of the worst crises in modern history. https://t.co/f9IkV9RHRL
Without the ACA coronavirus would be a preexisting condition that could make millions of Americans uninsurable. #DroptheLawsuit
NOW: Facebook Live on housing resources during COVID-19. https://t.co/GZGfpQSfFU

As COVID-19 spreads price-gouging is on the rise. This hurts families health care workers and hospitals.   It must stop.  I’m proud to introduce the COVID-19 Price Gouging Prevention Act with @janschakowsky @FrankPallone & @RepJerryNadler to finally ban this harmful practice.
War criminal Eddie Gallagher got a pardon. An aircraft carrier captain who raised warnings about COVID-19 lost his command. https://t.co/dbsOhqio4l

There are 5000 servicemembers aboard this ship.  This is exactly why @repmarkpocan and I demanded that @EsperDoD tell us what they’re doing to keep American troops safe during the COVID-19 pandemic.  This shouldn’t be difficult but we’re still waiting on an answer. https://t.co/3B6cQVzSps
Announced a $539K grant from HHS for Rhode Island to fight #COVID19 today. Lots more work to do but @SenJackReed @SenWhitehouse @JimLangevin and I are committed to getting the resources we need.

Even as tens of thousands of Americans test positive for coronavirus @realDonaldTrump is still in court trying to eliminate the ACA and kick millions of Americans off their insurance.  I’m proud to join @janschakowsky & 126 members in calling for Trump to drop this lawsuit. https://t.co/HZAU3KeYYV

NEW: My request with 37 members for stronger unemployment insurance in the next funding package.  #COVID19 has forced many workers into unemployment or reduced hours.  The federal government must step up to make sure states like Rhode Island have the funds necessary to help. https://t.co/PsLw58h1Ny

The #COVID19 pandemic is rapidly draining our supply of personal protective equipment.  This is a serious problem that requires a multifaceted response.  Thanks to @RepCindyAxne for her leadership on this request to deliver the urgent assistance our health care workers need! https://t.co/p77dpt0CTw
Let’s all take a moment tonight to remember the incredible first responders doctors nurses and scientists who are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 fight. https://t.co/tNe1BsJbKL

Proud to join @RepPaulTonko @DorisMatsui @RepJoeKennedy @RepScottPeters in the bipartisan fight to secure robust funding for mental health services as we craft the next #coronavirus emergency funding package. https://t.co/tDj0IvnYrM

Just led a group of 45 members calling on major credit card companies to stop collecting interest & waive all late fees until the coronavirus pandemic has ended.  Now is the time for everyone to do their part. These companies should step up and do theirs. https://t.co/73Ra8192Kb

NEW: Just led a request with @repmarkpocan demanding that @EsperDoD tell us what steps they’re taking to keep our servicemembers safe during the coronavirus pandemic.  There are currently tens of thousands of American troops stationed in countries with high numbers of infections. https://t.co/67Kh0JAby3
As we draft another round of emergency funding to respond to the coronavirus pandemic it’s important we address the following: https://t.co/Y4WD5WBZjM
NEW: Calling on the Trump administration to suspend foreclosures and evictions on federally backed mortgages in light of #COVID19. https://t.co/DytVX9laxn
Teleconferencing with my DC staff tonight as they work on coronavirus legislation oversight and the next round of federal funding. https://t.co/SDjobfhEDK
Pleased that the CDC awarded $4.9 million to Rhode Island today to fight #COVID19. Will keep working to get the resources we need.
As the number of coronavirus infections continues to climb I wrote about a few things every Rhode Islander should know.  Read my @projo op-ed: https://t.co/obOkOINMXZ

Holding a telephone town hall tomorrow at 7pm to take your questions on coronavirus & what Congress is doing. @RIHEALTH Director Nicole Alexander-Scott MD will join me on the call.  Click below to sign up now. https://t.co/7XVFOq0nqN
The President needs to demonstrate tonight that he understands the scale and severity of the coronavirus pandemic.
More than $3 billion for development of vaccines therapeutics and diagnostics to prevent or treat the effects of coronavirus.
(Thread) Later today the House will vote on an $8.3 billion emergency spending package to take on coronavirus. Here’s what’s in it:

Folks the Rhode Island Department of Health sent this out today and I wanted to make sure you had it.   -David  Press Release: First Presumptive Positive Case of COVID-19 Identified at RIDOH's State Health Laboratories  https://t.co/ovx000sRwM
Mike Pompeo is the Secretary of State. His job is to serve all Americans. His evasive answers on coronavirus today were a disgrace to the office he holds and the responsibility he has.
Why is the head of our coronavirus response speaking at CPAC right now instead of working on our response to coronavirus? https://t.co/PnlR1l0VlP
There was an outbreak of HIV in Indiana a few years ago because Governor Mike Pence was horrible on public health policy. So no I’m not relieved that Trump has him leading the coronavirus effort.
